item.title: Report X-2024120425
item.description:
Report X-2024120425

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-19
  • City: GREER
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment was discovered during sort operations. Held for security for inspection. Inner contents: 4 Sauvage parfum x 100 ml, 2 Prada Paradoxe x 90 ml, 2 Versace Bright Crystal x 90 ml, 2 Tom Ford Oud Wood x 100 ml, 2 Gucci Flora x 100 ml, 2 Tom Ford Tobacco x 100 ml, 2 Tom Ford F$@*kin Fabulous x 100 ml Miniatures- 1 Channel Bleu x 0.25 oz, 1 Chanel Chance Pink x 0.25 oz, 1 Tom Ford Lost Cherry x 7.4 ml, 1 Tom Ford Rose Prick 7.4 ml, 1 Tom Ford Fabulous 7.4 ml, 1 YSL Mon Paris 7.5 ml Outer packaging: box covered in tan masking tape. No Release. The commercial invoice states "16 pieces Rose Essential oils, material, Propanediol, melon aldehyde used for skin care." MSDS attached to the shipment (Rose Oil Essentials, Section 14: Not applicable. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report I-2024120005
item.description:
Report I-2024120005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: Townville
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE WHITAKER COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6365
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver after crossing a rough portion of I-85 noticed a mist in his mirror. He subsequently stopped as soon as possible pulling off the roadway, and off the shoulder as well to investigate. Noticed product Leaking from the rear of his trailer(approx 1/2 gal per min). He placed the absorbent pads he had, to catch what he could and notified his supervisor. His supervisor immediately notified TWC regulatory dept. We then determined what was Leaking and reached out to our response company whom notified DHEC and located a company who could respond. We decided to send personnel from our Spartanburg facility with more pads and catch containers. They arrived before the response company and were able to move some material around on the trailer and where able to close the valve on the IBC and re-secure the dust cap on the tote. They then started using pads to absorb what product they could, as DHEC and the Response company arrived. They then took over assessing the impact and cleanup of the lost material.
